text: Hamilton Loeb, Esq., and John M. Oseth, Esq., Paul,
label: H4

text: Hastings, Janofsky & Walker, for the protester.
label: H4

text: Leonard E, Moodispaw, Esq., for Essex Corporation, an
label: H4

text: interested party,
label: H4

text: Ronald E. Cone and Richard Leotta, Department of Energy, for
label: H4

text: the agency,
label: H4

label: H4

label: H4

label: H4

text: DIGEST
label: H4

text: Under a solicitation which called for the award of a
label: H4

text: cost reimbursement contract, agency properly rejected
label: H4

text: protester's proposal where, in response to the agency's
label: H4

text: request for updated proposals, protester modified various
label: H4

text: aspects of its cost proposal but failed to adequately
label: H4

text: document the basis for its modifications,
label: H4

text: Awardee's proposal complied with solicitation
label: H4

text: requirement for submission of letters of intent from key
label: H4

text: personnel where, although several individuals rescinded
label: H4

text: their initial agreement that they would be available
label: H4

text: exclusively to the awardee, they continued to indicate an
label: H4

text: intention to work for the awardee if it was the successful
label: H4

text: offeror.
label: H4

text: DECISION
label: H4

text: Pinkerton Security & Investigation Services protests the
label: H4

text: Department of Energy's (DOE) selection of Essex Corporation
label: H4

text: for award of a contract under request for proposals (RFP)
label: H4

text: No. DE-RP04-91AL72307. The RFP sought proposals to operate
label: H4

text: DOE's Transportation Safeguards Training Center in
label: H4

text: Albuquerque, New Mexico. Pinkerton asserts that DOE
label: H4

text: improperly evaluated Pinkerton's cost proposal and Essex's
label: H4

text: technical proposal.
label: H4

text: We deny the protest.
label: H4

text: tot "9
label: BODY

text: BACKGROUND
label: H4

text: This RFP was issued on March 11, 1991, and contemplated
label: H4

text: award of a cPntract to provide all personnel, facilities,
label: H4

text: equipment, :..pplies, and services necessary to operate the
label: H4

text: Transportation Safeguards Training Center, The solicitation
label: H4

text: provided that proposals would be evaluated under the
label: H4

text: following factors, listed in descending order of importance:
label: H4

text: me.iagerial/operational, business experience and corporate
label: H4

text: commitment, and cost.
label: H4

text: Under the managerial/operational factor, the solicitation
label: H4

text: identified certain key positions and provided that each
label: H4

text: offeror must submit letters of intent from the personnel it
label: H4

text: proposed to fill those positions, Regarding cost proposals,
label: H4

text: the solicitation stated that proposals would be evaluated,
label: H4

text: among other things, on the basis of;
label: H4

text: (1) "allowability,
label: H4

text: allocability, reasonableness, and adequacy of the proposed
label: H4

text: cost"; (2) "reasonableness and appropriateness of the
label: H4

text: compensation proposed for employees"; and (3) "probable cost
label: H4

text: to the Government." The solicitation expressly stated that
label: H4

text: offerors must submit adequate documentation to support their
label: H4

text: proposals and noted that unrealistic cost estimates could be
label: H4

text: grounds for eliminating a proposal from the competition.
label: H4

text: Initial proposals were submitted on April 19, 1991;
label: H4

text: discussions were subsequently conducted, and each offeror
label: H4

text: was asked to submit a "final revised proposal" by June 24.
label: H4

text: On August 21, DOE selected Wackenhut Services, Inc. for
label: H4

text: contract award, Thereafter, Essex filed a protest
label: H4

text: challenging Wackenhut's selection. We sustained Essex's
label: H4

text: protest on the basis that Wackenhut's proposal did not
label: H4

text: contain letters of intent for most of the key personnel whom
label: H4

text: Wackenhut proposed.2
label: H4

text: Essex Corn., B-246536.3, June 25,
label: H4

text: 1992, 92-2 CPD ¶ 170.' We recommended that DOE reevaluate
label: H4

text: the final revised proposals and, in the event those
label: H4

text: 'Although such submissions are usually referred to as "best
label: H4

text: and final offers," here, DOE referred to them as "final
label: H4

text: revised proposals"; our decision uses DOE's nomenclature.
label: H4

text: 2In our decision, we also found that, after Essex filed an
label: H4

text: agency-level protest, certain documents related to
label: H4

text: Wackenhut's proposal were altered to make it appear that
label: H4

text: Wackenhut's proposal met the solicitation requirements.
label: H4

text: 3We subsequently denied Wackenhut's request for
label: H4

text: reconsideration. Wackenhut Servs., Inc.--Recon.,
label: H4

text: proposals needed to be updated due to the passage of time,
label: H4

text: we recommended that DOE seek revisions only from offerors
label: H4

text: whose proposals complied with the solicitation requirements,
label: H4

text: The agency subsequently determined that only Pinkerton's and
label: H4

text: Essex's final revised proposals complied with the
label: H4

text: solicitation requirements. By letters dated September 4,
label: H4

text: 1992, DOE sought updated proposals from those offerors,
label: H4

text: which Pinkerton and Essex submitted on October 5.
label: H4

text: In evaluating Pinkerton's updated cost proposal, DOE
label: H4

text: determined that Pinkerton had decreased virtually all of the
label: H4

text: 36 direct labor rates contained in its proposal by a uniform
label: H4

text: amount, and also that Pinkerton had altered its labor
label: H4

text: overhead rates,4
label: H4

text: DOE also determined that Pinkerton's
label: H4

text: updated proposal provided virtually no documentation
label: H4

text: regarding the basis for its modified zates,
label: H4

text: In are effort to
label: H4

text: assess the reasonableness and realism of Pinkerton's new
label: H4

text: rates, DOE sought assistance from the Defense Contract Audit
label: H4

text: Agency (DCAA), asking that DCAA review Pinkerton's proposal
label: H4

text: and provide its opinion regarding the realism and
label: H4

text: reasonableness of Pinkerton's proposed costs, DCAA
label: H4

text: personnel subsequently reviewed Pinkerton's proposal at
label: H4

text: Pinkerton's offices and discussed the proposal with
label: H4

text: Pinkerton personnel, Upon completing its review, DCAA
label: H4

text: stated that "(Pinkerton) did not provide any supporting
label: H4

text: documentation to support the estimated labor rates," and
label: H4

text: concluded that "(wje do not consider the proposal to be
label: H4

text: acceptable as a basis Zor negotiation of a fair and
label: H4

text: reasonable price. "'
label: H4

text: Because of Pinkerton's failure to submit adequate
label: H4

text: documentation regarding the rates first presented in its
label: H4

text: updated proposal, DOE concluded it could not assess the
label: H4

text: "probable cost to the government" with regard to Pinkerton's
label: H4

text: proposal, as required by the solicitation.' DOE concluded
label: H4

text: that it must either reopen discussions to obtain additional
label: H4

text: 4 In light of the proprietary nature of the offerors' cost
label: H4

text: proposals, we will not discuss the specific individual costs
label: H4

text: associated with any of the offerors' proposals.
label: H4

text: 5In addition to Pinkerton's direct labor rates and labor
label: H4

text: overhead rates, DCAA questioned the general and
label: H4

text: administrative (G&A) rate which was contained in Pinkerton's
label: H4

text: earlier and updated proposals. The DCAA auditors noted that
label: H4

text: Pinkerton's actual G&A rate was substantially higher than
label: H4

text: that included in Pinkerton's proposals.
label: H4

text: 'In evaluating the probable cost to the government regarding
label: H4

text: Essex's proposal, DOE had upwardly adjusted Essex's proposed
label: H4

text: costs.
label: H4

text: information regarding Pinkerton's new rates, or reject
label: H4

text: Pinkerton's proposal as unacceptable
label: H4

text: Upon consideration,
label: H4

text: DOE rejected Pinkerton's proposal based on Pinkerton's
label: H4

text: failure to adequately document its proposed costs, On
label: H4

text: DOE selected Essex for award of a contract,
label: H4

text: This protest followed.
label: H4

text: DISCUSSION
label: H4

text: Pinkerton first complains that DOE's evaluation of its cost
label: H4

text: proposal was improper, arguing that DOE was obligated to
label: H4

text: either accept Pinkerton's proposal on the basis of the new,
label: H4

text: stated rates or reopen discussions with Pinkerton regarding
label: H4

text: those rates.
label: H4

text: DOE responds that the solicitation required offerors to
label: H4

text: submit documentation supporting the specific costs coitained
label: H4

text: in their proposals and specifically advised offerors that
label: H4

text: unrealistic cost estimates could be grounds for eliminating
label: H4

text: a proposal from the competition. DOE also notes that the
label: H4

text: updated proposals were the third submission of both
label: H4

text: offerors,
label: H4

text: E maintains that, since the defects in
label: H4

text: Pinkerton's proposal first appeared in the updated proposal,
label: H4

text: DOE was not required to discuss those detects with
label: H4

text: Pinkerton,
label: H4

text: In submitting proposal revisions, an offeror may change or
label: H4

text: amend any aspect of its prior proposal; however, in doing
label: H4

text: so, an offerors runs the risk that the changes may render a
label: H4

text: previously acceptable proposal unacceptable. See, et&.,
label: H4

text: Control Data Corp. and KET, Inc., 60 Comp. Gen. 548 (1981),
label: H4

text: 81-1 CPD $ 531; Federal Business Sys., Inc., B-246514,
label: H4

text: In evaluating revised
label: H4

text: proposals, a procuring agency is not obligated to reopen
label: H4

text: discussions in order to remedy a defect introduced into a
label: H4

text: previously acceptable proposal. RCA Serv. Co,, B-219643,
label: H4

text: We have reviewed the protest file in this matter and agree
label: H4

text: that Pinkerton's updated proposal contained virtually no
label: H4

text: documentation explaining and supporting the modified direct
label: H4

text: labor and overhead rates that Pinkerton first introduced in
label: H4

text: its updated proposal. Although Pinkerton asserts that the
label: H4

text: lower direct labor rates were derived from interviews with
label: H4

text: the various personnel it was intending to use in performing
label: H4

text: the contract, its updated proposal contains no documentation
label: H4

text: regarding such interviews, Further, the uniform nature of
label: H4

text: the rate decreases is inconsistent with the assertion that
label: H4

text: the reductions resulted from the individual input of
label: H4

text: multiple potential employees.
label: H4

text: l l a S
label: BODY

text: In its comments on the agency report, Pinkerton states:
label: H4

text: ''(Cjomparison of the Essex and Pinkerton (updatedJ
label: H4

text: proposals ,
label: H4

text: shows that a number of the
label: H4

text: individual {direct labor) rates Pinkerton proposed
label: H4

text: were lower than the rates Essex proposed for the
label: H4

text: same positions (although Pinkerton's qualitatively
label: H4

text: higher-ranked personnel slate would naturally cost
label: H4

text: somewhat more than Essex's overall) ."
label: H4

text: (Emphasis
label: H4

text: in original,)
label: H4

text: Rather than supporting Pinkerton's assertion that the agency
label: H4

text: had no basis to question its modified rates, this comment
label: H4

text: highlights DOE's legitimate concern regarding the realism of
label: H4

text: the Pinkerton's proposed personnel costs, since it suggests
label: H4

text: that Pinkerton might have been proposing more highly skilled
label: H4

text: personnel at unrealistically low rates,
label: H4

text: As noted above, the solicitation specifically provided that
label: H4

text: cost proposals must be evaluated on the basis of
label: H4

text: "reasonableness and appropriateness of the compensation
label: H4

text: proposed for employees" and "probable cost to the
label: H4

text: government," Clearly, under the terms of the solicitation,
label: H4

text: DOE was obligated to assess whether Pinkerton's new rates
label: H4

text: were reasonable and realistic and, in the event DOE
label: H4

text: concludec they were not, to determine what the probable
label: H4

text: costs under Pinkerton's proposal would likely be.
label: H4

text: submitting an updated proposal which modified various cost
label: H4

text: elements with little or no documentation, Pinkerton failed
label: H4

text: to comply with the solicitation requirement that proposals
label: H4

text: include adequate documentation to support proposed costs.
label: H4

text: DOE was thus justified in finding that it could not conclude
label: H4

text: that Pinkerton's revised costs were reasonable or calculate
label: H4

text: the probable actual cost to the government. On this record,
label: H4

text: the agency reasonably rejected Pinkerton's updated proposal.
label: H4

text: Pinkerton also protests that DOE's selection of Essex was
label: H4

text: improper because Essex's proposal failed to comply with the
label: H4

text: solicitation requirement regarding submission of letters of
label: H4

text: intent for key personnel. The solicitation required that
label: H4

text: letters of intent be submitted for 15 key personnel in
label: H4

text: 9 different labor categories. Pinkertonf asserts that
label: H4

text: Essex's proposal should have been rejected as failing to
label: H4

text: meet the letter-of-intent requirement for two specific
label: H4

text: individuals that Essex proposed as key personnel. Pinkerton
label: H4

text: acknowledges that Essex, in fact, submitted letters of
label: H4

text: intent for these two individuals but, after reviewing the
label: H4

text: documents provided by Essex and DOE in response to its
label: H4

text: protest, Pinkerton asserts that these two individuals
label: H4

text: rescinded their letters prior to Essex's submission of its
label: H4

text: updated proposal.
label: H4

text: Since DOE properly rejected Pinkerton's proposal as
label: H4

text: unacceptable, Pinkerton is not an interested party to
label: H4

text: challenge the source selection, see, e.g., Satellite
label: H4

text: Transmission Sys., ilnc., 70 Comp. Gent 624 (1991), 91-2 CPD
label: H4

text: In any event, based on our review of the record,
label: H4

text: Pinkerton's allegation is without merit, The letters of
label: H4

text: intent which Essex submitted for its key personnel initially
label: H4

text: gave Essex "exclusive" authority to include each of the key
label: H4

text: personnel in Essex's proposal. Subseqiently, several
label: H4

text: individuals, including the two on whom Pinkerton's protest
label: H4

text: focuses, wrote letters to Essex, stating that they were
label: H4

text: rescinding the exclusive nature of their commitments.
label: H4

text: However, each of the "rescission" letters specifically
label: H4

text: indicates an ongoing desire and intent to work for Essex,
label: H4

text: should Essex win the contract.
label: H4

text: As we explained in the previous protest regarding this
label: H4

text: procurement, provisions requiring submission of letters of
label: H4

text: intent are included in solicitations to provide agencies
label: H4

text: with assurances that the key personnel proposed by offerors
label: H4

text: are, in fact, intending to work for the offeror proposing
label: H4

text: them, Essex Corp., supra, Here, the record shows that
label: H4

text: Essex obtained and submitted letters of intent for all the
label: H4

text: key personnel it proposed, including the two individuals
label: H4

text: specifically challenged by Pinkerton, The rescission
label: H4

text: letters on which Pinkerton's protest relies do not negate
label: H4

text: the stated intent of those individuals to be available to
label: H4

text: perform the contract for Essex, Accordingly, Essex's
label: H4

text: proposal complied with the solicitation requirements.
label: H4

text: The protest is denied.
label: H4
